head.title: Reed to Miss His Next Start

hedline.hl1: Reed to Miss His Next Start

abstract.p: New York Mets pitcher Rick Reed, who strained muscle, will miss next start (M)2

block.p: The Mets right-hander Rick Reed, who left Saturday's start after three innings with a strained left oblique muscle, was still sore today and will skip his next start. ''I'm going to miss a start, there's no doubt about it,'' Reed said. ''It's something that's not going to heal overnight, obviously.''

Reed felt a sharp pain in his left side while throwing his warm-ups Saturday. He said he tried too hard to compensate for the discomfort, leading to his worst outing of the year: three innings, five runs on seven hits and three walks, and a 5-0 lead squandered.

The Mets right-hander Rick Reed, who left Saturday's start after three innings with a strained left oblique muscle, was still sore today and will skip his next start. ''I'm going to miss a start, there's no doubt about it,'' Reed said. ''It's something that's not going to heal overnight, obviously.''

Reed felt a sharp pain in his left side while throwing his warm-ups Saturday. He said he tried too hard to compensate for the discomfort, leading to his worst outing of the year: three innings, five runs on seven hits and three walks, and a 5-0 lead squandered.
The Mets came back to win, 12-8, but Manager Bobby Valentine said he was disappointed Reed did not mention the problem until after the third inning.
Reed's next turn in the rotation falls on Thursday, an off day. Valentine said he would skip Reed, hoping he could make his next start on June 6.
